com.is2t.mwt.composites
Class GridComposite

java.lang.Object
  ej.mwt.Widget
      ej.mwt.Composite
          com.is2t.mwt.composites.GridComposite
All Implemented Interfaces:
ej.mwt.Renderable
public class GridComposite
extends ej.mwt.Composite

A grid composite is a Composite that lays out its children in a grid. All columns have the same width, and all rows have the same height. The width of a grid cell is the width of the composite's parent divided by the number of columns. The height of a row is the maximum of the preferred heights of the children.

Constructor Summary
GridComposite(int columns)
           Creates a new horizontal grid composite specifying the number of columns.
Identical to calling GridComposite(int) with MWT.HORIZONTAL as direction.
GridComposite(int direction, int count)
           Creates a new grid composite specifying the number of columns/rows and the direction.
The direction can be MWT.HORIZONTAL or MWT.VERTICAL.
If MWT.HORIZONTAL then the count specifies the number of columns, and children are laid out across the top row until it is full and then on to the next row and so on.
If MWT.VERTICAL then the count specifies the number of rows, and children are laid out down the left column until it is full and then on to the next column and so on.

Constructor Detail

GridComposite

public GridComposite(int columns)

Creates a new horizontal grid composite specifying the number of columns.
Identical to calling GridComposite(int) with MWT.HORIZONTAL as direction.

Parameters:
columns - the number of columns
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if columns is negative or equals to zero

GridComposite

public GridComposite(int direction,
                     int count)

Creates a new grid composite specifying the number of columns/rows and the direction.
The direction can be MWT.HORIZONTAL or MWT.VERTICAL.
If MWT.HORIZONTAL then the count specifies the number of columns, and children are laid out across the top row until it is full and then on to the next row and so on.
If MWT.VERTICAL then the count specifies the number of rows, and children are laid out down the left column until it is full and then on to the next column and so on.

Parameters:
count - the number of columns or rows
direction - the direction of the grid
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if count is negative or equals to zero
Since:
1.0
Method Detail

validate

public void validate(int widthHint,
                     int heightHint)

Lays out children in a grid.

The size of each child is set to the size of a grid cell.

The parameters defines the maximum size available for this composite, or MWT.NONE if there is no constraint.
After this call the preferred size will have been established.

Specified by:
validate in class ej.mwt.Composite
Parameters:
widthHint - the width available for this widget or MWT.NONE
heightHint - the height available for this widget or MWT.NONE
